clinical_indications: Suspected pulmonary embolism | Acute dyspnea | Chest pain with elevated D-dimer
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. Reduce if eGFR 30-60
tech_notes: Caudocranial scan direction. Coach breath hold. ROI in main PA at level of bifurcation
nursing_notes: 20G or larger IV in antecubital preferred. Verify good flow before injection
radiologist_notes: Assess RV/LV ratio. Look for signs of right heart strain. Check for DVT in leg veins if imaged
safety_allergy_check: Check iodine allergy history and prior reactions
series_2_notes: Caudocranial direction from diaphragm to apices
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms fully raised to reduce beam hardening
additional_recons: MIP reconstructions of pulmonary arteries

clinical_indications: Abdominal pain | Oncology staging | Infection source | Post-operative complications
premedication_notes: Oral contrast: 900 mL Readi-Cat 2 over 90 minutes. Last cup 30 min before scan
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. Consider split bolus technique if eGFR 30-45
tech_notes: Ensure adequate oral contrast opacification. Scan from diaphragm through pubic symphysis. 70 second delay typical
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV required. Verify patent IV. May give rectal contrast for distal colon/rectal evaluation. Oral contrast 900mL given 2 hrs before
radiologist_notes: Systematic review of all solid organs. Check for free fluid/air. Assess bowel enhancement pattern
safety_allergy_check: Check allergy history. Pre-medicate if prior reaction
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms raised completely. Remove all metal objects from scan range
additional_recons: Thin slice 1mm for 3D if mass identified

clinical_indications: Acute stroke protocol | Head trauma | Headache - worst of life | Altered mental status
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast required
tech_notes: Minimize patient motion. Gantry angle parallel to skull base to reduce orbital dose. Ensure head straight
nursing_notes: No IV required. Explain importance of staying still
radiologist_notes: Look for hyperdense MCA sign. Assess grey-white differentiation. Check for hemorrhage and mass effect
artifact_reduction_tip: Remove dentures and hearing aids. Secure head in holder
additional_recons: Thin slice 1.25mm if subtle fracture suspected

protocol_name: CTA Head and Neck (Arch to Vertex)
clinical_indications: Stroke workup | Carotid stenosis | Vertebral artery dissection | Aneurysm screening
patient_positioning: Supine head-first with arms at sides
premedication_notes: None typically. Consider anxiolytic if severe claustrophobia
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Scan from aortic arch through vertex. Use bolus tracking in arch. Minimize dental artifact with gantry angulation
nursing_notes: Good antecubital IV access required - 20G minimum. Verify injection site for extravasation risk
radiologist_notes: Evaluate complete circle of Willis. Assess carotid bifurcations. Look for dissection. Check aneurysms
safety_allergy_check: Check allergy history and renal function
series_3_notes: Same bolus as neck - single acquisition
artifact_reduction_tip: Remove dentures. Minimize swallowing during neck acquisition
additional_recons: MIP and 3D VR reconstructions of vessels. Curved MPR of carotids

clinical_indications: Active GI bleeding | Hematemesis | Melena with hemodynamic instability | Hematochezia
contrast_timing_method: Triple phase: Arterial + Portal Venous + Delayed
contrast_labs_notes: Can proceed with eGFR > 30 in emergency. Document medical necessity
tech_notes: High flow rate critical for arterial phase. Scan arterial at 25 sec then portal at 70 sec then delayed at 90-180 sec. Look for active extravasation
nursing_notes: Large bore IV 18-20G essential. Must achieve 5 mL/s flow rate. Verify with saline test
radiologist_notes: Look for arterial extravasation (early) and pooling (delayed). Note location and potential source vessel
safety_renal_function: eGFR > 30 preferred but can proceed emergently
safety_allergy_check: Document allergy history. Emergency indication overrides mild allergy
series_4_notes: Extended delay to see pooling of contrast
postproc_3_notes: Look for contrast pooling in bowel
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms raised to avoid artifacts. Fast table speed to cover area quickly in arterial phase
additional_recons: MIP of all three phases side-by-side for comparison

author: Dr. Smith
clinical_indications: Aortic dissection | Aortic aneurysm | Vasculitis | Trauma pan-scan
patient_positioning: Supine with arms raised above head
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Single acquisition from thoracic inlet to pubic symphysis. Caudocranial direction. Bolus track in descending aorta
nursing_notes: 20G IV minimum. Antecubital or proximal forearm preferred
radiologist_notes: Assess entire aorta for dissection/aneurysm. Measure aortic dimensions. Check branch vessels
postproc_4_notes: Sagittal MIP and curved MPR of aorta
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms completely raised. ECG monitoring if known dissection
additional_recons: 3D VR and curved MPR of entire aorta

author: Dr. Johnson
clinical_indications: Thoracic aortic aneurysm | Aortic dissection | Great vessel evaluation
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Choose ROI based on indication - ascending aorta for aortic pathology or main PA for PE
nursing_notes: 20G IV minimum
radiologist_notes: Assess aorta and great vessels. Measure aneurysm if present. Look for dissection flap
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms fully raised
additional_recons: 3D VR of thoracic vasculature

author: Dr. Martinez
clinical_indications: Abdominal aortic aneurysm | Mesenteric ischemia | Renal artery stenosis | Pre-EVAR planning
premedication_notes: Oral contrast optional - omit for vascular indication
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. Critical for renal artery assessment
tech_notes: Caudocranial scan direction. Include renal arteries to femoral bifurcation minimum
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV antecubital
radiologist_notes: Measure AAA if present. Assess renal and mesenteric arteries. Evaluate iliac vessels
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms raised. No oral contrast for pure vascular study
additional_recons: 3D VR and curved MPR. Measure AAA in 3 planes

author: Dr. Lee
clinical_indications: Acute mesenteric ischemia | Chronic mesenteric ischemia | Bowel infarction
contrast_labs_notes: Proceed if eGFR > 30. Emergency indication in acute setting
tech_notes: Arterial phase at 25 sec for vessel assessment. Portal venous at 70 sec for bowel perfusion. High flow rate critical
nursing_notes: 18G IV required for 5 mL/s flow. Must be patent
radiologist_notes: Arterial: assess celiac SMA IMA origins. Portal: look for bowel wall enhancement. Check for pneumatosis
artifact_reduction_tip: Fast scan. High flow rate essential
additional_recons: MIP and 3D VR of celiac and SMA. Curved MPR of vessels

author: Dr. Williams
clinical_indications: Pre-operative planning for DIEP flap breast reconstruction
patient_positioning: Supine with arms at sides or on chest
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Scan from xiphoid to pubic symphysis. Focus on anterior abdominal wall perforators. Arterial phase critical
radiologist_notes: Map perforator locations. Measure vessel caliber. Identify dominant perforators. Note relationship to rectus
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms positioned to not obscure anterior abdominal wall
additional_recons: 3D VR color-coded perforator map. Measure distances from umbilicus

author: Dr. Davis
clinical_indications: Upper extremity arterial insufficiency | Trauma | Dialysis access planning | Thoracic outlet syndrome
patient_positioning: Supine with affected arm raised above head or at side depending on indication
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Scan from aortic arch to fingertips. May need bilateral for comparison. Position arm to demonstrate pathology
nursing_notes: 20G IV in contralateral arm
radiologist_notes: Assess subclavian axillary brachial radial ulnar arteries. Look for stenosis occlusion or injury
safety_allergy_check: Check allergy history. IV in opposite arm
artifact_reduction_tip: Position arm to avoid overlap with torso. May need special positioning for TOS
additional_recons: MIP and 3D VR. Subtract bones for vessel visualization

protocol_name: CTA Lower Extremity Runoff for PAD
author: Dr. Anderson
clinical_indications: Peripheral arterial disease | Claudication | Critical limb ischemia | Pre-operative bypass planning
patient_positioning: Supine with arms raised. Legs straight
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. May need larger volume for slow flow
tech_notes: Scan from renal arteries to feet. Use automatic bolus tracking. Extend delay if known severe PAD. Cover tibial vessels to ankle
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV antecubital
radiologist_notes: Assess aortoiliac femoral popliteal and tibial vessels. Grade stenoses. Identify occlusions. Assess runoff vessels
series_2_notes: May need slower table speed if severe PAD
artifact_reduction_tip: Ensure legs are straight and not rotated. Remove shoes and metal
additional_recons: MIP and 3D VR. Curved MPR of each arterial segment. Bone subtraction for vessels.

author: Dr. Thompson
clinical_indications: Popliteal entrapment syndrome | Exercise-induced leg pain | Young patient with claudication
patient_positioning: Supine with legs extended in neutral position
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: TWO acquisitions required: 1) Neutral position 2) Active plantarflexion. Both legs scanned for comparison. Coach patient on plantarflexion technique
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV antecubital
radiologist_notes: Compare neutral vs plantarflexion images. Look for popliteal artery compression deviation or occlusion with plantarflexion. Assess muscle anatomy
safety_allergy_check: Check allergy history. Explain plantarflexion maneuver to patient
series_3_notes: Patient actively plantarflexes both feet - point toes
artifact_reduction_tip: Coach patient on maintaining plantarflexion during second acquisition. Use foot straps if needed
additional_recons: Side-by-side comparison of neutral vs plantarflexion. 3D VR showing muscle-vessel relationship

author: Dr. Kim
clinical_indications: Pre-operative planning for free flap harvest (fibula ALT anterolateral thigh)
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Scan from iliac crest to ankle. Focus on perforators in region of interest. Arterial phase critical for mapping
radiologist_notes: Map perforator vessels. Measure vessel caliber and length. Identify dominant pedicle. Note anatomic variants
artifact_reduction_tip: Legs straight and not rotated. Mark skin over region of interest if possible
additional_recons: 3D VR perforator map. Curved MPR of main vessels. Measure perforator locations from bony landmarks

protocol_name: CTA Pelvis Cyclist Iliac Artery Maneuver
author: Dr. Rodriguez
clinical_indications: External iliac artery endofibrosis | Cyclist with exercise-induced leg symptoms
patient_positioning: Supine initially then with hip flexion
contrast_timing_method: Dual position: Resting + Hip flexion cycling position
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: TWO acquisitions: 1) Resting supine 2) Hip flexion simulating cycling position. Bilateral imaging for comparison
radiologist_notes: Compare resting vs flexed position. Look for iliac artery kinking stenosis or occlusion with hip flexion. Common in competitive cyclists
safety_allergy_check: Check allergy history. Explain hip flexion positioning
artifact_reduction_tip: Position patient with knees bent and hips flexed to simulate cycling. May need positioning aids
additional_recons: Side-by-side MIP of rest vs flexion. Measure degree of stenosis. 3D VR

author: Dr. Jackson
clinical_indications: Pre-procedural planning for prostate artery embolization | Benign prostatic hyperplasia
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Scan from L3 to proximal femur. Arterial phase essential. Focus on internal iliac branches and prostate supply
radiologist_notes: Identify prostate artery origins (usually anterior division of internal iliac). Map anatomy for IR. Note variants and anastomoses
artifact_reduction_tip: Full bladder helpful for prostate visualization. Coordinate with IR before scan
additional_recons: 3D VR with prostate vessels highlighted. Curved MPR of internal iliac branches. Measure vessel diameters

author: Dr. Chen
clinical_indications: Deep vein thrombosis | May-Thurner syndrome | IVC filter placement planning | Venous malformation
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Scan at 180 seconds for venous phase. Slower injection rate OK for venous imaging. Scan from diaphragm to femoral veins
radiologist_notes: Assess IVC iliac femoral veins for thrombosis. Look for compression (May-Thurner). Measure vessel caliber for filter sizing
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms raised. May add leg veins if DVT suspected
additional_recons: MIP venograms. 3D VR of venous system

author: Dr. White
clinical_indications: Superior vena cava syndrome | Central venous occlusion | Tumor staging with venous involvement
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Scan at 180 seconds. Include SVC through femoral veins. May need arm injection for SVC assessment
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV - may need bilateral arm IVs for SVC
radiologist_notes: Assess SVC IVC and major tributaries. Look for thrombosis compression or tumor invasion
safety_allergy_check: Check allergy history. May need bilateral IVs
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms raised. For SVC consider bilateral arm injection
additional_recons: 3D venogram MIP. Curved MPR of SVC and IVC

author: Dr. Hayes
clinical_indications: Spontaneous coronary artery dissection screening | Fibromuscular dysplasia screening | Multi-vessel arterial assessment
patient_positioning: Supine with arms initially UP then DOWN
contrast_timing_method: Multi-phase: NC Head + CTA Neck + CTA CAP arms up + Post-contrast Head arms down
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. Large volume for multiple phases
tech_notes: FOUR acquisitions: 1) NC Head arms down 2) CTA Neck bolus track 3) CTA CAP arms up 4) Post Head arms down. Patient repositions arms between scans
nursing_notes: 20G IV minimum. Verify good flow for multiple phases
radiologist_notes: Screen all vascular beds for FMD. Look for beading stenosis aneurysm dissection. Assess renal carotid vertebral intracranial arteries
safety_allergy_check: Check allergy history. Explain arm repositioning
artifact_reduction_tip: Coach patient on arm repositioning. Multiple phases require good IV. Plan scan sequence carefully
additional_recons: Comprehensive MIP and 3D VR of all vascular beds. Measure vessel diameters. Document FMD findings

author: Dr. Smith
clinical_indications: Cardiovascular risk assessment | Chest pain low-intermediate risk | Asymptomatic screening
premedication_notes: HR control not needed for calcium score
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast required
tech_notes: Prospective ECG gating. 3mm slices. Cover entire heart. 75% R-R interval typical. Ensure ECG leads well connected
nursing_notes: No IV needed. Apply ECG leads carefully. Explain breath hold
radiologist_notes: Calculate Agatston score. Report percentile for age/sex. Document coronary calcification distribution
artifact_reduction_tip: Good ECG tracing essential. Patient breath hold coaching
additional_recons: Agatston score calculation. Percentile reporting

author: Dr. Johnson
clinical_indications: Post-CABG graft patency assessment | Recurrent chest pain post-bypass
premedication_notes: HR < 60 target. Metoprolol 5mg IV increments up to 15mg. Nitro 0.4mg SL before scan
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Retrospective gating for CABG. FULL CHEST FOV to include grafts. Extended coverage from thoracic inlet to below heart. Pitch 0.2-0.24
nursing_notes: 20G IV minimum. HR control critical - target < 60. Nitro administration
radiologist_notes: Assess all grafts: LIMA RIMA SVG. Check anastomoses. Native vessel disease. Graft patency vs occlusion
postproc_1_notes: Thin slice for grafts and native vessels
artifact_reduction_tip: Full chest coverage essential. Extended FOV. Low pitch for retrospective gating
additional_recons: Curved MPR of all grafts. Label LIMA RIMA SVG. 3D VR color-coded

author: Dr. Johnson
clinical_indications: Intermediate chest pain | Suspected infarct | Coronary artery dissection or aneurysm | Anomalous coronary artery | Stent patency
premedication_notes: HR < 60 target. Metoprolol 5mg IV increments up to 15mg. Nitro 0.4mg SL before scan
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Retrospective ECG gating. 3mm slices. Cover entire heart. 75% R-R interval typical. Ensure ECG leads well connected
nursing_notes: 20G IV minimum. HR control critical - target < 60. Nitro administration
radiologist_notes: Calculate Agatston score. Give CAD-RADS score. Check function look for potential focal wall motion abnormalities
postproc_1_notes: Thin slice for grafts and native vessels
artifact_reduction_tip: Full chest coverage essential. Extended FOV. Low pitch for retrospective gating
additional_recons: Curved MPR of all grafts. Label LIMA RIMA SVG. 3D VR color-coded

author: Dr. Martinez
clinical_indications: Endocarditis | Cardiac mass | Valve vegetation | Intracardiac thrombus
premedication_notes: HR < 65 preferred. Metoprolol if needed. Nitro not typically needed
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Retrospective gating. Cover entire heart. Focus on valves and chambers. May need delayed phase for perfusion
nursing_notes: 20G IV. HR control helpful but not critical
radiologist_notes: Assess all valves for vegetations. Evaluate myocardium for abscess. Look for intracardiac masses. Check for complications
artifact_reduction_tip: Multiple cardiac phases helpful for valve motion. Thin slices for vegetations
additional_recons: Multi-phase reconstructions. 4-chamber 2-chamber views. Valve-specific reformats

author: Dr. Lee
clinical_indications: Aortic dissection | Aortic aneurysm with cardiac involvement | Combined cardiac and aortic pathology
premedication_notes: HR < 65 target. Metoprolol 5mg IV prn. Nitro 0.4mg SL
contrast_timing_method: Dual phase: Gated chest + Flash AP
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. Large volume needed
tech_notes: TWO acquisitions: 1) Gated retrospective CHEST 2) Flash helical ABDOMEN/PELVIS. Chest gated for aortic root. AP flash arterial
nursing_notes: 20G IV minimum
radiologist_notes: Gated chest: assess aortic root valve coronaries. Flash AP: assess aorta and branches. Combined cardiac and vascular
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms up. Careful timing between gated and flash acquisitions
mas: Auto ECG chest / High mAs AP
additional_recons: Curved MPR full aorta. Aortic valve reformats. 3D VR

author: Dr. Williams
clinical_indications: Pre-operative planning for redo sternotomy | Retrosternal structures assessment
premedication_notes: HR < 65. Metoprolol IV prn. Nitro 0.4mg SL
contrast_timing_method: Triple phase: Gated chest + AP arterial + Chest venous
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. Large volume protocol
tech_notes: THREE acquisitions: 1) Gated CHEST 2) Flash AP arterial 3) CHEST venogram 60 sec delay. Venous for retrosternal structures
nursing_notes: 20G IV
radiologist_notes: Gated: cardiac anatomy. Arterial: systemic vessels. VENOUS: retrosternal veins and adherent structures critical for surgical planning
safety_allergy_check: Large contrast load - verify renal function
artifact_reduction_tip: Venous phase critical for surgical planning. Map all retrosternal structures
mas: Auto ECG chest / High mAs other
additional_recons: 3D VR venogram highlighting retrosternal veins. Distance measurements sternum to heart

author: Dr. Davis
clinical_indications: Pre-TAVR planning | Aortic stenosis valve replacement planning
premedication_notes: HR < 65 target. Metoprolol IV. Nitro 0.4mg SL
contrast_timing_method: Dual phase: Gated chest + Flash AP
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Gated CHEST retrospective + Flash AP. Gated for valve measurements. AP for access planning. TAVR post-processing required
nursing_notes: 20G IV antecubital
radiologist_notes: Measure aortic annulus (3 diameters). Coronary heights. Access vessels (iliofemoral). Valve calcium. Comprehensive TAVR measurements
postproc_3_notes: En face aortic annulus for sizing
artifact_reduction_tip: TAVR-specific measurements protocol. Thin slices critical
mas: Auto ECG chest / High mAs AP
additional_recons: TAVR measurements: annulus area perimeter diameters. Coronary heights. Sinus of Valsalva. STJ. Ascending aorta. Access vessels

author: Dr. Anderson
clinical_indications: Coronary artery disease | Chest pain | Anomalous coronaries | Coronary CTA
premedication_notes: HR < 60 target. Metoprolol 5mg IV up to 15mg total. Nitro 0.4mg SL. Check BP > 100
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Retrospective ECG gating. Cover heart. Bolus tracking in ascending aorta. Optional stent protocol: add 40 sec delayed phase
nursing_notes: 20G IV minimum. HR control critical. Nitro administration. Monitor BP
radiologist_notes: Assess coronaries for stenosis plaque. Evaluate anomalous anatomy. Stent patency if applicable. Cardiac function from multi-phase
artifact_reduction_tip: HR control essential. Coach breathing. Gating quality check
additional_recons: Curved MPR all coronaries. Short/long axis. Multi-phase for function. Calcium score

protocol_name: Gated CTA Chest Post-op Cardiac Valve
author: Dr. Thompson
clinical_indications: Post-operative valve assessment | Prosthetic valve evaluation | Post-surgical complications
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. Increased volume for metal artifact
tech_notes: Retrospective gating. INCREASED kV to 130-140 for metal artifact reduction. Increased contrast 1.3 mL/kg. Extended reconstruction phases
nursing_notes: 20G IV minimum
radiologist_notes: Assess prosthetic valve function. Look for paravalvular leak. Evaluate perivalvular complications. Metal artifact reduction critical
artifact_reduction_tip: High kV (130-140) critical for metal artifact. Increased contrast volume
additional_recons: Multi-phase reconstructions. Valve-specific views. Paravalvular assessment

protocol_name: Gated CTA Heart Left Atrial Mapping
author: Dr. Kim
clinical_indications: Pre-ablation planning | Atrial fibrillation | Pulmonary vein anatomy
premedication_notes: HR < 65 preferred. Metoprolol if needed. Nitro not typically required
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Retrospective gating. Focus on left atrium and pulmonary veins. Thin slices critical. Extended coverage for all PV ostia
nursing_notes: 20G IV
radiologist_notes: Map pulmonary vein anatomy (number ostia diameters). Left atrial appendage morphology. Esophageal position. LA size
postproc_4_notes: 3D LA and PV reconstruction for EP
artifact_reduction_tip: Thin slices essential. Complete PV coverage. Document variants
additional_recons: 3D LA reconstruction. PV ostia measurements (diameter area). LAA morphology. Esophageal position

author: Dr. Rodriguez
clinical_indications: Pre-TMVR planning | Mitral valve replacement planning | Mitral regurgitation
contrast_timing_method: Dual phase: Gated chest NO dose modulation + 90 sec delayed CAP
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Gated CHEST with NO DOSE PULSING (full dose all phases) + delayed 90 sec CAP. TMVR post-processing required
nursing_notes: 20G IV
radiologist_notes: Measure mitral annulus. LA size. LVOT assessment. Coronary proximity. Access vessels. TMVR-specific measurements
series_2_notes: NO DOSE PULSING - retrospective all phases
artifact_reduction_tip: NO dose modulation for gated chest. Full radiation all phases for valve assessment
mas: NO ECG MODULATION chest / Auto AP
additional_recons: TMVR measurements: annulus dimensions. LVOT area. Coronary heights. LA volume. Access vessels

author: Dr. Jackson
clinical_indications: Pre-TTVR planning | Tricuspid valve replacement planning | Tricuspid regurgitation
contrast_timing_method: Dual phase: Gated chest NO dose modulation + 90 sec delayed CAP
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Gated CHEST with NO DOSE PULSING + delayed 90 sec CAP. TTVR post-processing required
nursing_notes: 20G IV
radiologist_notes: Measure tricuspid annulus. RA size. RV function. Coronary proximity. Access vessels. TTVR-specific measurements
artifact_reduction_tip: NO dose modulation. Full dose all cardiac phases
mas: NO ECG MODULATION chest / Auto AP
additional_recons: TTVR measurements: annulus dimensions area perimeter. RA volume. RV function. Coronary proximity. Access vessels

protocol_name: CT Chest Abdomen Pelvis with Contrast
author: Dr. Smith
clinical_indications: Oncology staging | Infection source | Abdominal pain | Trauma
npo_status: NPO 4 hours solids. Clear liquids OK up to 2 hours
premedication_notes: Oral contrast: 250-500 mL neutral (Volumen or water). Give 60-90 min before scan
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. High volume protocol
tech_notes: Single phase portal venous. Oral contrast for bowel opacification. 40 second injection. 70 second scan delay from start of injection
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV. Adequate oral contrast intake. Verify renal function
radiologist_notes: Portal venous phase optimal for solid organ and bowel assessment. Systematic review all organs
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms fully raised. Neutral oral contrast preferred over positive
additional_recons: Sagittal reformats optional

author: Dr. Johnson
clinical_indications: Nephrolithiasis | Renal colic | Flank pain | Hematuria
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. No oral contrast
tech_notes: LOW DOSE protocol. Reduced mAs. Cover kidneys to pubic symphysis. Stone protocol settings
nursing_notes: No IV needed. No oral contrast. Explain low radiation technique
radiologist_notes: Look for stones - measure size and location. Check for hydronephrosis. Assess for alternative diagnoses
artifact_reduction_tip: Low dose protocol. Reduced mAs. Image quality adequate for stones
additional_recons: Thin slice 1mm for small stones. Stone size measurements

author: Dr. Martinez
clinical_indications: Crohn disease | Small bowel obstruction | Obscure GI bleeding | Small bowel mass
premedication_notes: Neutral oral contrast (VoLumen): 1st bottle (450mL) at 90 min. 2nd bottle (450mL) at 60 min. Half bottle (225mL) at 30 min. Other half (225mL) at 5 min before scan
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. High flow rate
tech_notes: Enterographic phase (45 sec). High volume neutral oral for bowel distension. 25 second injection. Scan 45 sec from start
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV. Ensure adequate oral contrast intake (total ~1350mL). May need anti-peristaltic agent
radiologist_notes: Assess bowel wall enhancement and thickness. Look for strictures fistulas abscesses. Mesenteric vascularity
safety_allergy_check: Check allergy history. Coordinate oral contrast timing
artifact_reduction_tip: Adequate oral contrast distension critical. High injection rate
additional_recons: Curved MPR of bowel segments. Mesenteric vascular assessment

author: Dr. Lee
clinical_indications: Liver lesion characterization | HCC surveillance | Liver mass protocol
contrast_timing_method: Triple phase: NC + Arterial + Portal Venous + Delayed
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: FOUR acquisitions: 1) NC abdomen 2) Late arterial (bolus track or 30-35s) 3) Portal venous 70s 4) Delayed 5 min. FOV: Abdomen for NC/Art/Delay. Full AP for PV
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV. High flow rate critical
radiologist_notes: NC: characterize lesion. Arterial: hypervascular lesions HCC. Portal: most liver lesions. Delayed: washout pattern
artifact_reduction_tip: High flow rate. Extended 5 min delay. Breath hold coaching

author: Dr. Williams
clinical_indications: Pancreatic mass | Pancreatitis | Pancreatic cyst characterization
premedication_notes: Water PO: 900 mL water orally 15-30 min before scan for gastric/duodenal distension
contrast_timing_method: Dual phase: Pancreatic arterial + Portal venous
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: TWO phases: Pancreatic phase (40-45s or bolus track) + Portal venous (70s). Water for negative contrast
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV. Ensure water intake for duodenal distension
radiologist_notes: Pancreatic phase: optimal pancreatic enhancement and small lesions. Portal venous: liver and venous structures
safety_allergy_check: Check allergy history. Coordinate water intake
artifact_reduction_tip: Water distension of duodenum helpful. Thin slices for pancreas
additional_recons: Curved MPR pancreatic duct. MIP pancreatic vasculature

author: Dr. Davis
clinical_indications: Renal mass characterization | Renal cell carcinoma staging | Complex cyst evaluation
contrast_volume: Split bolus: 1st injection 1.1 mL/kg + 2nd injection 0.4 mL/kg
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. Split bolus technique
tech_notes: COMPLEX protocol: 1) NC 2) 1st contrast injection 3) Arterial 20s after 1st 4) WAIT 5-7 min 5) 2nd injection + saline 6) IVP/nephrographic 90-120s after 2nd
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV. Explain split bolus technique and delay
radiologist_notes: NC: fat/calcification. Arterial: vascular anatomy and hypervascular masses. Nephrographic/IVP: delayed enhancement and collecting system
artifact_reduction_tip: Split bolus timing critical. 5-7 min wait between injections
additional_recons: Compare NC vs arterial vs nephrographic. Measure HU in mass. MIP urogram

author: Dr. Anderson
clinical_indications: Hematuria | Urothelial carcinoma | Collecting system evaluation | Hydronephrosis
contrast_volume: Split bolus: 1st injection 1.1 mL/kg + 2nd injection 0.4 mL/kg
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. Split bolus for combined nephrographic and excretory phases
tech_notes: COMPLEX protocol: 1) NC (optional stone protocol) 2) 1st contrast injection 3) Early PV 60s after 1st 4) WAIT 5-7 min 5) 2nd injection + saline 6) Excretory/IVP 90-120s after 2nd
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV. Split bolus technique. May give Lasix 10-20mg IV for better opacification
radiologist_notes: NC optional: detect stones. Early PV: renal parenchyma. Excretory: collecting system ureters bladder for urothelial lesions
artifact_reduction_tip: Split bolus critical for opacification. Lasix may help. Prone imaging optional for ureters
additional_recons: MIP urogram coronal and sagittal. Curved MPR of ureters. 3D urogram

author: Dr. Thompson
clinical_indications: Adrenal mass characterization | Adenoma vs metastasis | Incidentaloma workup
contrast_timing_method: Triple phase: NC + Portal venous + 15 min delay
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: THREE phases: 1) Non-contrast for absolute HU 2) Portal venous 70s 3) 15 MINUTE delayed for washout. All phases cover adrenals
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV. Patient must wait 15 min for delayed phase
radiologist_notes: NC: lipid-rich adenoma < 10 HU. Portal venous: enhancement. 15 min delay: calculate washout (adenoma shows washout)
safety_allergy_check: Check allergy history. Explain 15 min delay
artifact_reduction_tip: Patient wait time 15 min. Measure HU carefully with ROI in same location
additional_recons: Calculate absolute washout: (Enhanced HU - Delayed HU)/(Enhanced HU - NC HU) x 100. >60% suggests adenoma. Measure HU in all phases

author: Dr. Kim
clinical_indications: Bladder rupture | Bladder injury | Post-operative bladder assessment | Hematuria with bladder concern
contrast_volume: IV: 100 mL. Bladder: 350-400 mL dilute contrast (30 mL contrast in 350 mL saline)
contrast_labs_notes: eGFR > 30 for IV. Bladder instillation via Foley
tech_notes: TWO components: 1) CT with IV contrast portal venous 2) Bladder filling via Foley with dilute contrast 3) Scan distended bladder 4) Post-void scan. Coordinate with nursing
nursing_notes: Foley catheter required. Dilute contrast preparation (30mL in 350mL saline). Gravity fill bladder. Patient signals fullness
radiologist_notes: Portal venous: solid organs. Cystogram: bladder integrity extravasation. Post-void: small leaks
artifact_reduction_tip: Adequate bladder distension critical. Gravity fill slowly. Clamp Foley during scan
additional_recons: Compare distended vs post-void. Document extravasation location. 3D reformation if complex injury

author: Dr. Smith
clinical_indications: Trauma head injury | C-spine clearance | Multi-trauma assessment
patient_positioning: Supine head-first. Cervical collar in place
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. Trauma indication
tech_notes: TWO acquisitions: 1) Head vertex to C1 2) C-spine skull base to T1. Head: 5mm axial. C-spine: 0.625mm with reformats. Minimize movement
nursing_notes: Maintain cervical precautions. C-collar remains on. Document GCS
radiologist_notes: Head: acute hemorrhage skull fractures. C-spine: fractures alignment ligamentous injury
artifact_reduction_tip: Keep C-collar on. Minimize patient movement
additional_recons: C-spine: Sagittal and coronal bone reformats. 3D if complex fracture

protocol_name: Trauma Head C-Spine and Facial Bones
author: Dr. Johnson
clinical_indications: Facial trauma | Maxillofacial fractures | Orbital fractures with head/spine injury
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast
tech_notes: THREE acquisitions: 1) Head 2) C-spine 3) Facial bones. Face: submillimeter helical for 3D. C-collar remains
nursing_notes: C-collar precautions. Document mechanism of injury
radiologist_notes: Head: intracranial injury. C-spine: fractures. Face: Le Fort midface orbital mandible fractures
artifact_reduction_tip: C-collar on. Remove dentures if safe
additional_recons: 3D face reconstruction. Le Fort classification. Orbital floor assessment

author: Dr. Martinez
clinical_indications: Blunt chest trauma | Rib fractures | Pneumothorax | Hemothorax
patient_positioning: Supine with arms raised if possible
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast for initial chest trauma
tech_notes: Single acquisition lung apices to costophrenic angles. RIB REFORMATS required. Submillimeter acquisition
nursing_notes: Trauma precautions. Arms up if able
radiologist_notes: Pneumothorax hemothorax. Rib fractures (count and location). Pulmonary contusion. Aortic injury. Sternal/scapular fractures
artifact_reduction_tip: Submillimeter acquisition critical for rib detail
additional_recons: Dedicated rib reformats (oblique sagittal each rib). Count fractures. 3D chest wall

protocol_name: Trauma CTA Chest with PV CT AP
author: Dr. Lee
clinical_indications: Blunt thoracic trauma | Aortic injury | Great vessel injury | Multi-trauma
contrast_timing_method: Dual phase: CTA Chest arterial + Portal venous AP
contrast_labs_notes: Proceed if possible. Document medical necessity
tech_notes: TWO acquisitions: 1) CTA CHEST arterial (bolus track) 2) Portal venous ABDOMEN/PELVIS 70s. Chest arterial for aorta/vessels
nursing_notes: Large bore IV 18-20G. Verify flow
radiologist_notes: Chest arterial: aortic injury (intimal flap pseudoaneurysm). AP portal venous: solid organ injury
artifact_reduction_tip: Trauma indication. Fast scan. Good IV essential
additional_recons: 3D aorta and great vessels. Curved MPR aorta. Grade aortic injury

author: Dr. Williams
clinical_indications: Extremity vascular injury | Penetrating trauma | Fracture with vascular concern | Pulseless extremity
contrast_roi_placement: Abdominal aorta or proximal to injury
contrast_labs_notes: Proceed with trauma indication
tech_notes: Extend coverage based on injury. Aorta to ankles if bilateral. May do unilateral focused study. Arterial phase
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV. May need proximal IV if arm injury
radiologist_notes: Assess arterial injury: transection pseudoaneurysm occlusion extravasation. Evaluate fracture relationship to vessels
artifact_reduction_tip: Tailor coverage to injury. Fast acquisition
additional_recons: MIP and 3D VR. Document vascular injury. Measure vessel caliber

author: Dr. Davis
clinical_indications: Ruptured AAA | Aortic emergency | Hemodynamic instability with abdominal pain
contrast_timing_method: Triple phase: NC + Arterial + Portal venous
contrast_labs_notes: Proceed emergently. Life-saving indication
tech_notes: RAPID triple phase: 1) NC CAP (hematoma) 2) Arterial CAP (active bleed bolus track 25-30s) 3) Portal venous CAP (70s). STAT protocol
nursing_notes: Large bore IV 18G minimum. Blood products ready
radiologist_notes: NC: retroperitoneal hematoma. Arterial: active extravasation aneurysm morphology. Portal: solid organs
artifact_reduction_tip: STAT protocol. Minimize delays. Notify vascular surgery
additional_recons: Measure aneurysm. Identify bleeding site. EVAR measurements if stable

author: Dr. Anderson
clinical_indications: Pregnant trauma patient | Multi-trauma pregnancy | Maternal injury assessment
patient_positioning: Supine with left lateral tilt if possible
contrast_labs_notes: Proceed with trauma indication. Document medical necessity and gestational age
tech_notes: Portal venous phase 70s. SINGLE PHASE to minimize fetal radiation. Shield uterus if injury distant. Document weeks gestation
nursing_notes: Pregnancy documented. Fetal heart tones if equipment available. Shield if possible
radiologist_notes: Assess maternal injuries. Minimize fetal radiation exposure. Document placental injury if visible
artifact_reduction_tip: Document gestational age. Shield fetus if possible. Minimize radiation

author: Dr. Thompson
clinical_indications: Pulmonary nodule | Interstitial lung disease screening | Chest pain low risk | Follow-up
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast required
tech_notes: Standard dose helical chest. Lung apices to costophrenic angles. Routine lung and mediastinal windows
nursing_notes: No IV needed. Breath hold coaching
radiologist_notes: Assess lung parenchyma nodules masses. Mediastinal lymph nodes. Pleura. Incidental findings
artifact_reduction_tip: Full inspiration breath hold
additional_recons: Thin slice 1mm for nodule detection and measurement

author: Dr. Kim
clinical_indications: Lung cancer screening | Low risk pulmonary nodule follow-up | Smoking history screening
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. Lung cancer screening protocol
tech_notes: LOW DOSE technique. Reduced mAs 30-50% of standard. Helical acquisition. High IR strength
nursing_notes: No IV. Explain screening purpose and low radiation
radiologist_notes: Lung nodule detection. Measure nodules. Lung-RADS classification. Emphysema assessment
artifact_reduction_tip: Low dose protocol. High iterative reconstruction. Nodule measurement software
additional_recons: CAD nodule detection. Measure all nodules 3mm. Lung-RADS reporting

protocol_name: Non-Contrast Chest Lung Nodule Ultra Low Dose
author: Dr. Rodriguez
clinical_indications: Pulmonary nodule follow-up | Known nodule surveillance | Post-treatment monitoring
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. Ultra low dose for follow-up only
tech_notes: ULTRA LOW DOSE 10-20% standard dose. For follow-up of KNOWN nodules only. Not for initial detection. Maximum IR
nursing_notes: No IV. Known nodule follow-up only
radiologist_notes: Follow known nodules. Compare to prior. Measure size. Not for initial detection
artifact_reduction_tip: Ultra low dose. Maximum IR. Prior comparison essential

author: Dr. White
clinical_indications: Interstitial lung disease initial evaluation | ILD diagnosis | Diffuse lung disease
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. ILD protocol
tech_notes: TWO acquisitions: 1) Full INSPIRATION 2) Limited EXPIRATION (carina to bases). Volumetric (contiguous thin slice). Coach breathing
nursing_notes: No IV. Careful breath hold coaching. Inspiration and expiration
radiologist_notes: ILD pattern recognition. Honeycombing. Ground glass. Reticular. Mosaic attenuation on expiration
artifact_reduction_tip: Volumetric contiguous slices. Coach breathing carefully
additional_recons: Thin slice for ILD detail. Compare inspiration vs expiration. Quantitative analysis if available

author: Dr. Hayes
clinical_indications: Air trapping assessment | Small airways disease | Constrictive bronchiolitis | Hypersensitivity pneumonitis
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. Air trapping protocol
tech_notes: THREE acquisitions: 1) INSPIRATION 2) MID-EXPIRATION 3) FULL EXPIRATION. Non-volumetric (1-2cm intervals). Lower dose than volumetric
nursing_notes: No IV. Coach three breathing phases carefully
radiologist_notes: Mosaic attenuation. Air trapping. Small airways disease. Compare three phases
artifact_reduction_tip: Coach three distinct breath holds. Non-volumetric lower dose
additional_recons: Side-by-side comparison of three phases. Quantify air trapping

author: Dr. Chen
clinical_indications: HRCT follow-up | Known ILD monitoring | Bronchiectasis assessment
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast
tech_notes: Single INSPIRATION phase. Non-volumetric (1-2cm intervals). Lower dose for follow-up
nursing_notes: No IV. Single inspiration breath hold
radiologist_notes: Follow ILD changes. Bronchiectasis. Lower radiation than volumetric
artifact_reduction_tip: Non-volumetric reduces dose. Good for follow-up
additional_recons: Target slices through abnormality. Compare to prior

author: Dr. Martinez
clinical_indications: Dependent atelectasis vs fibrosis | Posterior lung assessment | ILD with gravity-dependent changes
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. Prone positioning
tech_notes: Single INSPIRATION. PRONE position. Non-volumetric (1-2cm intervals). Distinguish atelectasis from fibrosis
nursing_notes: Position patient prone safely. Cushion support. Breath hold coaching
radiologist_notes: Differentiate dependent atelectasis from true fibrosis. Posterior lung better aerated prone
artifact_reduction_tip: Safe prone positioning. Compare to supine if available
additional_recons: Compare prone to supine to differentiate atelectasis from fibrosis

author: Dr. Lee
clinical_indications: Tracheomalacia | Bronchomalacia | Expiratory central airway collapse | EDAC
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. Airway dynamics
tech_notes: TWO acquisitions: 1) INSPIRATION carina to carina+10cm 2) MID-EXPIRATION same level. Cine if available. Airway reconstructions required
nursing_notes: No IV. Coach dynamic breathing. May need forced expiration
radiologist_notes: Measure tracheal collapse percentage. >50% collapse suggests tracheomalacia. Assess bronchi
artifact_reduction_tip: Coach forced expiration. Exact same level both phases
additional_recons: Measure tracheal AP diameter inspiration vs expiration. Calculate collapse percentage. 3D airway

author: Dr. Patel
clinical_indications: Emphysema quantification | COPD assessment | Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency | Pre-LVRS
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. Quantitative protocol
tech_notes: TWO VOLUMETRIC acquisitions: 1) Full INSPIRATION 2) FULL EXPIRATION (complete exhalation). Contiguous thin slices. Quantitative software
nursing_notes: No IV. Coach complete inspiration and complete expiration
radiologist_notes: Quantify emphysema (% lung <-950 HU inspiration). Air trapping (% lung <-856 HU expiration). Emphysema distribution
artifact_reduction_tip: Complete exhalation critical for RV. Volumetric contiguous
additional_recons: Quantitative emphysema analysis. Report % lung <-950 HU. Air trapping metrics. Upper/lower lobe distribution

author: Dr. Williams
clinical_indications: Acute stroke | CVA | Neurological deficit < 24 hours | Stroke code
contrast_labs_notes: Proceed emergently. Time is brain
tech_notes: STAT protocol: 1) NC Head 2) CTA Head/Neck (aortic arch to vertex) 3) CTP (optional). Minimize door-to-scan time
nursing_notes: No IV for NC. Large bore for CTA/CTP. STAT coordination
radiologist_notes: NC: hemorrhage early ischemia hyperdense vessel. CTA: LVO large vessel occlusion. CTP: penumbra core mismatch
artifact_reduction_tip: STAT protocol. Minimize delays. LVO detection critical
additional_recons: CTA MIP and 3D. CTP perfusion maps if done. ASPECTS score. LVO documentation

author: Dr. Thompson
clinical_indications: Aneurysm screening | Subarachnoid hemorrhage | Vascular malformation | Intracranial stenosis
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: NC Head optional then CTA skull base to vertex. Bolus tracking. Submillimeter for 3D reconstruction
nursing_notes: 20G IV minimum. Good bolus essential
radiologist_notes: Assess circle of Willis. Aneurysms. Stenosis. Vascular malformations. Anatomic variants
artifact_reduction_tip: Minimize motion. Thin slices for small aneurysms
additional_recons: 3D VR and MIP. Measure aneurysm if present. Assess A1 A2 dominance

author: Dr. Kim
clinical_indications: Carotid stenosis | Vertebral artery dissection | Neck vessel assessment | Pre-CEA planning
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: Aortic arch to skull base. Bolus tracking in arch. Submillimeter. Minimize swallowing during scan
nursing_notes: 20G IV antecubital preferred
radiologist_notes: Assess carotid bifurcations. Stenosis grading. Vertebral arteries. Dissection. Plaque morphology
artifact_reduction_tip: Minimize swallowing. Submillimeter acquisition
additional_recons: Curved MPR both carotid bifurcations. Measure stenosis (NASCET). 3D VR. MIP

author: Dr. Rodriguez
clinical_indications: Venous sinus thrombosis | Dural sinus thrombosis | Intracranial hypertension | Venous malformation
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: NC Head then delayed venous CTV (60-90 sec). Skull base to vertex. Assess venous sinuses
radiologist_notes: NC: hemorrhage. CTV: filling defects in sinuses. Venous thrombosis. Cortical vein thrombosis
artifact_reduction_tip: Delayed timing 60-90 sec. Look for filling defects
additional_recons: 3D VR venogram. MIP maximum intensity projection. Document filling defects

author: Dr. Hayes
clinical_indications: Sinusitis | Sinus disease | Pre-operative sinus surgery | Nasal obstruction
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast
tech_notes: Coronal acquisition skull base through maxillary sinuses. Submillimeter for anatomy. Bone and soft tissue windows
nursing_notes: No IV. Remove dentures and metal
radiologist_notes: Assess all sinuses. Ostiomeatal complex. Anatomic variants. Mucosal thickening. Polyps. Bony anatomy
artifact_reduction_tip: Direct coronal preferred. Submillimeter for anatomy
additional_recons: Document anatomic variants (Haller cells concha bullosa). OMC assessment

author: Dr. Chen
clinical_indications: Pre-operative sinus surgery planning | Image-guided surgery | ENT surgical navigation
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. Surgical navigation
tech_notes: Submillimeter isotropic acquisition. DICOM for surgical navigation system. May need fiducial markers. Entire sinus anatomy
nursing_notes: Position as for surgery. Fiducials if required
radiologist_notes: Complete sinus anatomy for surgical navigation. Ostiomeatal complex. Skull base. Lamina papyracea
artifact_reduction_tip: Isotropic voxels essential. DICOM for navigation
additional_recons: Export DICOM to surgical navigation system. Isotropic 0.625mm

author: Dr. Martinez
clinical_indications: Facial trauma | Orbital fractures | Zygoma fractures | Nasal fractures | Mandible fractures
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. Trauma or facial injury
tech_notes: Frontal sinus to mandible. Submillimeter for 3D. Axial acquisition with multiplanar reformats. Remove dentures
nursing_notes: Remove all facial metal. Dentures out
radiologist_notes: Le Fort classification. Orbital floor. Zygoma. Nasal bones. Mandible. NOE complex. 3D for surgical planning
artifact_reduction_tip: Remove dentures and facial metal
additional_recons: 3D surface rendering. Document Le Fort if present. Orbital floor assessment

author: Dr. Lee
clinical_indications: Stereotactic surgery planning | DBS planning | Biopsy planning | Surgical navigation | Gamma knife
patient_positioning: Supine in surgical position. Head in frame if required
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast unless tumor. Stereotactic protocol
tech_notes: Submillimeter ISOTROPIC acquisition. Vertex to skull base. DICOM for surgical planning. Frame or fiducials if required
nursing_notes: Position exactly as for surgery. Frame placement if required
radiologist_notes: Isotropic high-resolution for surgical targeting. Anatomic landmarks. Tumor if contrast
artifact_reduction_tip: Isotropic voxels critical. Export DICOM to surgical planning
additional_recons: Export to surgical navigation. Isotropic 0.5mm. Coordinates for targeting

author: Dr. Davis
clinical_indications: Orbital mass | Thyroid eye disease | Orbital cellulitis | Optic nerve assessment | Trauma
contrast_labs_notes: Contrast if mass/infection. NC for trauma/foreign body
tech_notes: Orbits: superior orbital rim to maxillary sinus. Axial 1-2mm. Coronal reformats. NC for trauma. Contrast for masses/inflammation
nursing_notes: Contrast for mass or inflammation. NC for trauma and metallic foreign body
radiologist_notes: Extraocular muscles. Optic nerve. Globe integrity. Orbital fat. Preseptal vs postseptal. Masses. Foreign body
postproc_1_notes: Bone for fractures soft tissue for pathology
artifact_reduction_tip: Angle axial parallel to optic nerves. Thin slices
additional_recons: Assess optic nerve canal. Measure EOMs if thyroid eye disease. Document foreign body

author: Dr. Anderson
clinical_indications: Hearing loss | Chronic otitis | Cholesteatoma | Temporal bone fracture | Pre-operative cochlear implant
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. High resolution bone algorithm
tech_notes: Temporal bones: external auditory canal to petrous apex. SUBMILLIMETER <0.625mm. Direct axial and direct coronal if possible. Ultra high resolution
nursing_notes: No IV. Remove hearing aids and earrings
radiologist_notes: Ossicles. Cochlea. Semicircular canals. Internal auditory canal. Mastoid air cells. Cholesteatoma. Fracture. Tegmen
artifact_reduction_tip: Submillimeter critical. Sharp bone kernel. Remove all metal
additional_recons: Pschl and Stenvers oblique reformats for IAC. Measure vestibular aqueduct

author: Dr. Thompson
clinical_indications: Neck mass | Deep neck infection | Abscess | Airway assessment | Lymphadenopathy
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30. Contrast essential
tech_notes: Skull base to thoracic inlet. 60-70 sec delay for venous phase. Arms down. Minimize swallowing. May need NC if calcium assessment
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV. Coach no swallowing during scan
radiologist_notes: Assess neck spaces. Retropharyngeal. Parapharyngeal. Masticator. Parotid. Submandibular. Thyroid. Lymph nodes. Abscess vs phlegmon
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms down. Minimize swallowing. Quiet breathing
additional_recons: Assess all neck spaces. Measure lymph nodes. Airway diameter if concern

author: Dr. Kim
clinical_indications: Hyperparathyroidism | Parathyroid adenoma localization | Pre-operative parathyroid planning
contrast_labs_notes: Full dose if eGFR > 30
tech_notes: FOUR phases: 1) NC 2) Arterial 25s 3) Venous 55s 4) Delayed/washout 90s. Skull base to mediastinum. Parathyroid enhances early washes out
nursing_notes: 18-20G IV. High flow rate for arterial
radiologist_notes: NC: baseline. Arterial: parathyroid lights up. Venous: thyroid enhances. Delayed: parathyroid washes out faster than thyroid
artifact_reduction_tip: Four phase critical. Look for early enhancement and washout
additional_recons: Subtraction images. Compare all phases. Document location for surgeon. Measure size

author: Dr. Rodriguez
clinical_indications: Cervical spine trauma | Degenerative disease | Neck pain | Radiculopathy | Myelopathy
contrast_labs_notes: NC typical. Contrast for infection tumor or post-op
tech_notes: Skull base to T1. Submillimeter helical. Sagittal and coronal reformats required. Bone algorithm
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast needed. Cervical precautions if trauma
radiologist_notes: Alignment. Fractures. Disc spaces. Neural foramina. Spinal canal. Facet joints. Degenerative changes
artifact_reduction_tip: Minimize motion. C-collar if trauma
additional_recons: Sagittal and coronal bone reconstructions. Oblique for foramina

author: Dr. White
clinical_indications: Thoracic spine trauma | Compression fracture | Back pain | Tumor | Infection
contrast_labs_notes: NC typical. Contrast for infection tumor mets
tech_notes: C7 to L1. Submillimeter helical. Sagittal and coronal reformats. Arms up if possible
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast indicated. Arms up to reduce artifact
radiologist_notes: Alignment. Compression fractures. Pedicles. Spinal canal. Disc spaces. Paraspinal soft tissues
artifact_reduction_tip: Arms up reduces artifact. Bone algorithm

author: Dr. Hayes
clinical_indications: Lumbar spine trauma | Degenerative disease | Back pain | Radiculopathy | Sciatica
contrast_labs_notes: NC typical. Contrast for infection tumor or post-op with hardware
tech_notes: T12 to sacrum. Submillimeter helical. Sagittal and coronal reformats. Oblique for foramina
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast needed
radiologist_notes: Alignment. Fractures. Disc spaces. Spinal canal stenosis. Neural foramina. Facet joints. Spondylolisthesis
artifact_reduction_tip: Bone algorithm. Sagittal and coronal reconstructions
additional_recons: Oblique sagittal for foramina. Measure spinal canal. Grade stenosis

author: Dr. Chen
clinical_indications: Spine trauma pan-scan | Multi-level disease | Metastatic survey | Infection
contrast_labs_notes: NC for trauma. Contrast for mets or infection
tech_notes: Skull base to sacrum. LONG COVERAGE. Submillimeter. Sagittal and coronal entire spine. May do in segments
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast needed. Complete spine coverage
radiologist_notes: Entire spine alignment. Fractures all levels. Spinal canal. Paraspinal masses. Metastatic disease
artifact_reduction_tip: Long coverage. May need multiple acquisitions
additional_recons: Sagittal and coronal bone reconstructions. Oblique for foramina

author: Dr. Martinez
clinical_indications: Post-myelogram CT | Intrathecal contrast follow-up | Spinal stenosis | Nerve root compression
contrast_labs_notes: Intrathecal contrast given by clinician via LP
tech_notes: Post-LP CT. Usually lumbar region. Thin slices. Axial and sagittal reformats. Assess nerve root sleeves and thecal sac
nursing_notes: Patient already had LP with IT contrast. Position comfortably
radiologist_notes: Nerve root sleeves. Thecal sac compression. Spinal stenosis. Disc herniations. Surgical planning detail
artifact_reduction_tip: Post-LP headache precautions. Thin slices for nerve detail
additional_recons: Oblique reformats for nerve roots. Document stenosis level and severity

author: Dr. Lee
clinical_indications: Pre-operative planning | Post-operative assessment | Infection | Mass | Soft tissue tumor | Abscess
contrast_labs_notes: Contrast for infection mass post-op. NC for trauma hardware
tech_notes: Field of view specific to region. Submillimeter if 3D needed. NC and/or contrast based on indication. Delayed phase (5-10 min) for infection/tumor
nursing_notes: IV for contrast studies. Document indication
radiologist_notes: NC: baseline bone soft tissue. Contrast: enhancement pattern. Delayed: washout or persistent enhancement. 3D for surgical planning
artifact_reduction_tip: Tailor protocol to clinical question. Bilateral for comparison
additional_recons: Compare to contralateral side. Measure lesions. Bone and soft tissue windows

author: Dr. Patel
clinical_indications: Ankle fracture | Ligament injury | Pilon fracture | Pre-operative planning | Hardware assessment
contrast_labs_notes: NC for trauma. Contrast for infection or soft tissue mass
tech_notes: Include distal tibia/fibula through hindfoot. Submillimeter for 3D. Bilateral scout for positioning. May scan bilateral for comparison
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast needed
radiologist_notes: Malleolar fractures. Tibial plafond. Talus. Calcaneus. Syndesmosis. Ligaments on contrast
artifact_reduction_tip: Bilateral scout for symmetry. Submillimeter for 3D
additional_recons: 3D reconstruction for surgical planning. Document fracture fragments

author: Dr. Davis
clinical_indications: Foot fracture | Lisfranc injury | Tarsal fractures | Foreign body | Pre-operative planning
contrast_labs_notes: NC for trauma foreign body. Contrast for infection osteomyelitis
tech_notes: Calcaneus through toes. Submillimeter. Weight-bearing position if able. Bilateral for comparison
nursing_notes: No IV unless infection suspected
radiologist_notes: Calcaneus. Talus. Navicular. Cuneiforms. Metatarsals. Phalanges. Lisfranc ligament. Plantar fascia
artifact_reduction_tip: Weight-bearing if possible. Bilateral comparison helpful
additional_recons: Document Lisfranc alignment. Calcaneal angles. 3D if complex

author: Dr. Johnson
clinical_indications: Gout | Tophi | Urate deposition | CPPD | Crystal arthropathy
contrast_labs_notes: No contrast. Dual energy CT preferred
tech_notes: Dual energy CT if available for urate detection. Single energy if not. Cover affected joint(s). Extended FOV if polyarticular
nursing_notes: No IV. Document affected joints
radiologist_notes: Urate crystals color-coded on DECT. Tophi. Joint erosions. Soft tissue deposits. Quantify urate burden
artifact_reduction_tip: Dual energy preferred for urate detection
additional_recons: Urate volume quantification. Color overlay. Document tophi locations

author: Dr. Thompson
clinical_indications: Knee fracture | Tibial plateau | Patellar fracture | Pre-operative planning | Hardware evaluation
contrast_labs_notes: NC for trauma. Contrast for infection or tumor
tech_notes: Distal femur through proximal tibia/fibula. Submillimeter. Extended FOV for alignment. Bilateral scout
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast indicated
radiologist_notes: Tibial plateau fractures (Schatzker). Femoral condyles. Patella. Fibula. Cruciate ligaments on contrast. Menisci
artifact_reduction_tip: Bilateral scout for alignment assessment
additional_recons: Schatzker classification if tibial plateau. Measure alignment. 3D reconstruction

author: Dr. White
clinical_indications: Upper extremity fracture | Humerus | Radius/ulna | Forearm | Elbow injury
contrast_labs_notes: NC for trauma. Contrast for infection or soft tissue mass
tech_notes: FOV based on region: shoulder to hand. Submillimeter for fracture detail. Position for comfort and coverage
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast needed
radiologist_notes: Fractures. Alignment. Intra-articular extension. Comminution. Soft tissue injury on contrast
artifact_reduction_tip: Position for patient comfort and diagnostic quality
additional_recons: Document fracture location alignment. Soft tissue windows if contrast

author: Dr. Rodriguez
clinical_indications: Lower extremity fracture | Tibia/fibula | Femur | Post-operative hardware assessment
contrast_labs_notes: NC for trauma. Contrast for infection osteomyelitis
tech_notes: FOV based on region: hip to ankle. Submillimeter for fracture. Extended coverage for alignment
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast needed
radiologist_notes: Fractures. Alignment. Comminution. Intra-articular extension. Hardware position. Infection on contrast
artifact_reduction_tip: Extended coverage for alignment measurements
additional_recons: Alignment measurements. Hardware position. 3D for surgical planning

author: Dr. Anderson
clinical_indications: Hip fracture | Acetabular fracture | Femoral neck | Pre-operative planning | FAI assessment
contrast_labs_notes: NC for trauma. Contrast for infection AVN or tumor
tech_notes: Iliac crests through proximal femurs. Bilateral for comparison. Submillimeter for 3D acetabular reconstructions
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast indicated
radiologist_notes: Femoral neck fractures. Acetabular fractures (Judet/Letournel). Hip dislocation. FAI morphology. AVN
artifact_reduction_tip: Bilateral coverage. Submillimeter for acetabular 3D
additional_recons: 3D pelvis. Judet oblique views. Letournel classification. FAI measurements (alpha angle)

author: Dr. Kim
clinical_indications: Pelvic fracture | Sacral fracture | SI joint | Pelvic ring injury | Pre-operative planning
contrast_labs_notes: NC for trauma. Contrast for infection or tumor
tech_notes: Iliac crests to proximal femurs. Submillimeter for 3D. Assess pelvic ring integrity. Inlet and outlet views
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast indicated
radiologist_notes: Pelvic ring fractures (Young-Burgess). Sacral fractures (Denis). Acetabulum. SI joints. Symphysis pubis
artifact_reduction_tip: Submillimeter for 3D pelvic reconstruction
additional_recons: 3D pelvis. Inlet and outlet views. Young-Burgess classification. Measure displacement

author: Dr. Chen
clinical_indications: Hand fracture | Scaphoid fracture | Metacarpal fracture | Foreign body | Pre-operative planning
patient_positioning: Prone with hand extended (superman position) or supine with arm at side
contrast_labs_notes: NC for trauma foreign body. Contrast for infection
tech_notes: Distal radius/ulna through fingertips. Submillimeter. Position hand flat. Bilateral scout for comparison
nursing_notes: No IV unless infection suspected
radiologist_notes: Carpal fractures (scaphoid navicular lunate). Metacarpals. Phalanges. CMC joints. Foreign bodies
artifact_reduction_tip: Superman position preferred. Submillimeter for scaphoid
additional_recons: Scaphoid-specific views. 3D if complex. Document foreign body location

author: Dr. Hayes
clinical_indications: Wrist fracture | Distal radius fracture | Carpal fracture | DRUJ | Scapholunate ligament
patient_positioning: Prone with wrist extended (superman) or positioned for comfort
contrast_timing_method: Non-contrast typical. Arthrogram contrast if ligament assessment
contrast_labs_notes: NC for fracture. Arthrogram for ligament
tech_notes: Distal radius/ulna through carpus. Submillimeter for carpal detail. Extended for forearm if needed
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast or arthrogram needed
radiologist_notes: Distal radius fractures. Carpal fractures (scaphoid). DRUJ. Carpal alignment. Ligaments on arthrogram
artifact_reduction_tip: Position for comfort. Submillimeter for carpal bones
additional_recons: Scaphoid views. Carpal alignment. 3D if complex fracture

author: Dr. Martinez
clinical_indications: Elbow fracture | Radial head fracture | Olecranon fracture | Coronoid | Terrible triad
patient_positioning: Supine with elbow extended if possible or positioned for comfort
contrast_labs_notes: NC for trauma. Contrast for infection or soft tissue mass
tech_notes: Distal humerus through proximal radius/ulna. Submillimeter. Position extended if possible. Bilateral for comparison
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast needed
radiologist_notes: Distal humerus fractures. Radial head. Olecranon. Coronoid. Elbow dislocation. Terrible triad
artifact_reduction_tip: Position extended if possible. Submillimeter for detail
additional_recons: Document terrible triad if present. Radial head-capitellum alignment. 3D reconstruction

author: Dr. Lee
clinical_indications: Shoulder fracture | Proximal humerus | Glenoid | Scapula | Rotator cuff calcification
contrast_labs_notes: NC for trauma. Contrast for infection or tumor
tech_notes: Include entire scapula and proximal humerus. Submillimeter for glenoid detail. Y-views for scapula
nursing_notes: No IV unless contrast indicated
radiologist_notes: Proximal humerus fractures (Neer). Glenoid fractures. Scapular fractures. AC joint. Rotator cuff calcifications
artifact_reduction_tip: Include entire scapula. Submillimeter for glenoid
additional_recons: 3D reconstruction. Neer classification if proximal humerus. Glenoid version measurements

author: Dr. Patel
clinical_indications: Labral tear | Rotator cuff tear | Capsular injury | Shoulder instability
contrast_labs_notes: Arthrogram contrast injected under fluoro or US
tech_notes: Post-arthrogram CT. Inject glenohumeral joint. Immediate CT after injection. Thin slices for labrum
nursing_notes: Radiologist performs injection. Patient to CT immediately after
radiologist_notes: Labral tears. Rotator cuff tears. Capsular tears. Glenohumeral ligaments. Paralabral cysts
artifact_reduction_tip: Scan immediately after injection. Thin slices for labrum
additional_recons: Oblique coronal and sagittal. Assess labrum rotator cuff capsule. Document contrast extravasation
